timeline.message:
[quickfix] Integration tests for BuildpathQuickFixProcessor

Ported from the old ImportPackageQuickFixProcessorTest.

A number of these tests don't quite work properly in the new implementation;
I have left these in there, but annotated @Disabled so that they don't
interfere with the CI output.

Fixes #3881.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>

[github actions] Change to use xvfb for Ubuntu builds

Allows testing of components that have GUIs.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>

[github actions] Change to use xvfb for Ubuntu builds

Allows testing of components that have GUIs.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>

[github actions] Change to use xvfb for Ubuntu builds

Allows testing of components that have GUIs.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>

[github actions] Change to use xvfb for Ubuntu builds

Allows testing of components that have GUIs.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>

[bndtools test] Moved workbench sync code from WorkbenchExtension to Activator

Made the tests bundle lazy. This ensures that it is not started during startup,
but by the tester thread when it first tries to load the test class. The start()
method will then block until the workbench is ready.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>

[bndtools test] Moved workbench sync code from WorkbenchExtension to Activator

Made the tests bundle lazy. This ensures that it is not started during startup,
but by the tester thread when it first tries to load the test class. The start()
method will then block until the workbench is ready.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>

[github actions] Change to use xvfb for Ubuntu builds

Allows testing of components that have GUIs.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>

[quickfix] Integration tests for BuildpathQuickFixProcessor

Ported from the old ImportPackageQuickFixProcessorTest.

A number of these tests test old features that don't quite work properly in
the new implementation or potential features that have not yet been
implemented (eg, inner classes). I have left these in there, but annotated
@Disabled so that they don't interfere with the CI output.

Fixes #3881.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>

A number of these tests test old features that don't quite work properly in

implemented (eg, inner classes). I have left these in there, but annotated
@Disabled so that they don't interfere with the CI output.

Fixes #3881.

Signed-off-by: Fr Jeremy Krieg <fr.jkrieg@greekwelfaresa.org.au>

timeline.bodyText: This whole repo is dual licensed under AL2 OR EPL2. Not sure why you have this license header here.
timeline.author: bjhargrave
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,154 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2009, 2015 IBM Corporation and others.
+ *
+ * This program and the accompanying materials
+ * are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License 2.0
+ * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+ * https://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0/
+ *
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0

replies.bodyText: This is a cut-and-paste error. NullContextPresentationEngine started off life as a clone of https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.platform.ui/blob/master/tests/org.eclipse.e4.ui.tests/src/org/eclipse/e4/ui/tests/application/HeadlessContextPresentationEngine.java
replies.author: kriegfrj

timeline.bodyText: simple.bnd already has these packages as exported, so we can remove the duplicate Export annotation here.
timeline.author: bjhargrave

timeline.bodyText: simple.bnd already has these packages as exported, so we can remove the duplicate Export annotation here.
timeline.author: bjhargrave

replies.bodyText: Fair enough, but just curious - what's best practice, to use the annotation or to mark it for export in the .bnd file?
replies.author: kriegfrj
